abdominal_hepatobiliary.liver: Homogeneously hypodense, consistent with fatty change. No focal lesions.
abdominal_hepatobiliary.biliary_dilatation: No evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation.

gallbladder.stones: Not well visualized on the current examination.
gallbladder.pericholecystic_fluid: Mild pericholecystic fluid and fat stranding with mild gallbladder wall thickening.
gallbladder.irregularity: Mild irregularity and thinning of the enhancing gallbladder wall adjacent to the liver without a frank perforation.
gallbladder.free_fluid: Small amount of free fluid tracking along the subhepatic space without localized drainable fluid collection.
gallbladder.diverticulum: A diverticulum at the hepatic flexure without colonic wall thickening to suggest acute diverticulitis.

findings.pancreas: Normal attenuation throughout, without focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation.
findings.spleen: Normal size and attenuation throughout, without focal lesions.

urinary.kidneys: Normal and symmetric size with normal nephrogram. No evidence of focal renal lesions or hydronephrosis.

findings.gastrointestinal: Stomach is unremarkable. Small bowel loops and colon are unremarkable aside from scattered diverticula.
findings.pelvis: Urinary bladder is distended with a right posterolateral diverticulum. No free fluid in the pelvis.
findings.reproductive_organs: Minimal projection of the median lobe of the prostate into the bladder base.
findings.vascular: No abdominal aortic aneurysm. Moderate atherosclerotic disease noted.
findings.bones: No evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture.
findings.soft_tissues: Abdominal and pelvic wall is within normal limits.
